page.title: 17SURVEY OF QUEEN ADELAIDE(ii)
page.content: 5 people come into Adelaide to work:the 3 level_crossing keepers and 2 men who repair cars at St.Johns Garage.This garage no longer sells petrol though it still has the 1950s petrol pumps on the forecourt.Everyone else travels to work in Ely,is employed on the surrounding farms or is retired.The post office is open on weekdays from 9am to noon and 2.45pm to 5.30pm except for Wednesdays and Saturdays when it closes at 12.30pm.It also sells the local newspaper,'The Cambridge Evening News' and fishing tickets which cost Â£1.00 for a days fishing.One householder sells vegetables and soft fruit from his large garden and another sells eggs and goats milk from her smallholding. Everyone has to go into Ely to shop,by bus on a Thursday or Saturday or by car.
